title: Hydroclimatic instability accelerated the socio-political decline of the Tang Dynasty in northern China
abstract:
Political instability, recurrent floods and droughts, and unsustainable crop production weakened food security, contributing to the decline of the Tang Dynasty in the late 9th and early 10th centuries CE, according to a multicomponent hydroclimatic vulnerability model. 
 Extreme flooding and prolonged, intensifying droughts have played a critical role in the rise and collapse of preindustrial states and empires worldwide, triggering cascading impacts such as crop failure, famine, and migration that undermined socio-political stability and economic resilience. We present a multicomponent hydroclimatic vulnerability model for crop supply networks to estimate the contribution of climatic stressors as one of several factors contributing to the decline of the late Tang Dynasty in northern China between 800 and 907 CE. We demonstrate that recurrent flooding and prolonged droughts, combined with an unsustainable shift in crop production from drought-tolerant millet to less resilient wheat and rice, led to harvest failures and food shortages during the cooler and drier climatic conditions of the late 9th and early 10th centuries CE. Intensifying raiding from competing polities and climatic extremes further affected grain supplies for the late Tang’s northern military frontier and partly contributed to the sudden decline of the dynasty. Our results emphasize the importance of multicomponent environmental response models to understand historical transformations and provide new aspects of China’s socio-political development during medieval times. explanation: 该研究论文主要探讨了东亚地区人为气溶胶减排对西北太平洋地区快速变暖的影响。研究发现，气溶胶减排导致该地区云量减少，从而增加了到达地面的短波辐射，进而导致海面温度升高。研究使用了耦合气候模型模拟来量化气溶胶减排对海面温度的影响，并揭示了气溶胶-云相互作用的非线性特征。虽然论文没有直接提及特定的遥感技术或卫星观测，但它与大气成分分析（特别是气溶胶）以及气候变化研究密切相关，因此与大气环境遥感技术具有很强的关联性。

authors: Nan Yang;Yan Xia;Fei Xie;Chuanfeng Zhao;Tianyi Fan;Yannian Zhu
title: Aerosol emission reductions cause post-2011 rapid warming in the northwestern Pacific
abstract:
Anthropogenic aerosol mitigation in East Asia has resulted in rapid warming in the north-western Pacific, according to analyses of coupled climate model simulations. 
 The northwestern Pacific has exhibited an anomalously rapid warming since 2011, causing significant climate disasters and marine ecosystem destruction. Yet the drivers of this accelerated warming remain insufficiently understood. Here we find that anthropogenic aerosol mitigation constitutes the principal driver of this phenomenon. During 2011 − 2022, aerosol reduction induces a 2.3 ± 0.91% decline in cloud cover over the downwind northwestern Pacific region, generating a 6.1 ± 2.4 W m−² enhancement in surface shortwave radiation that explains 72 ± 28% of the observed sea surface temperature rise. Aerosol-driven ocean warming manifests a five-year lag post-emission reductions, governed by threshold-triggered nonlinear aerosol-cloud interaction, where cloud decrease occurs only below critical aerosol thresholds. Coupled climate model simulations isolate a 0.25  ±  0.14 °C/decade warming signal attributable to aerosol reductions, which accounts for 66 ± 51% of the simulated warming in 2011 − 2022. These findings provide crucial implications for future climate policy formulation. Anthropogenic aerosol mitigation in East Asia has resulted in rapid warming in the north-western Pacific, according to analyses of coupled climate model simulations.

title: Land conversion to energy crops for sustainable aviation fuel production reduces greenhouse gas emissions in the United States
abstract:
In the US, the cropland and non-cropland conversion from existing uses to cellulosic feedstocks for sustainable aviation fuels reduces the net greenhouse gas emissions intensity, according to a framework that combines economic, biochemical, and feedstock-specific process engineering models. 
 Energy crops will be critical for scaling up production of Sustainable Aviation Fuel in the United States and reducing greenhouse gas emissions. Here we examine the economic incentives for the extent and type of land conversion needed to scale up fuel production from a mix of cellulosic feedstocks and quantify its greenhouse gas intensity. We show that even with the availability of marginal non-cropland, there will be incentives for converting cropland to produce energy crops as the price of sustainable aviation fuel increases. But contrary to expectations, we find that scaling up fuel production by converting more cropland and more non-cropland from existing uses to energy crops lowers its net greenhouse gas intensity, due to high soil carbon sequestration rate of energy crops, even after considering land use change emissions.The potential savings in emissions are larger than the foregone soil carbon accumulation benefits from keeping that land in current uses.

title: Macroalgal ecosystem provides a scalable solution to coastal herbicide pollution via macroalga–microbiome synergy
abstract:
Ulva macroalgal ecosystem is a highly efficient natural bioremediation system, reducing coastal triazine herbicides by up to 89% through pathways involving macroalga-microbiome synergistic functions, according to a field investigation combined with designed simulation conducted in Yellow Sea, China. 
 The increasing discharge of land-derived phytotoxic herbicides threatens oceanic primary production by inhibiting phytoplankton photosynthesis. Macroalgae also contribute significantly to ocean productivity, yet their responses to herbicides remain poorly understood. Here, using the annual Ulva prolifera green tide in the Yellow Sea as a natural model, we show that large-scale macroalgal blooms act as an effective multi-pathway bioremediation system for herbicides. U. prolifera reduced triazine herbicide concentrations by 32–89% across coastal waters, with some compounds becoming undetectable. The macroalgae displayed strong tolerance to atrazine and achieved high removal efficiency through direct bioaccumulation (bioconcentration factor >5,000 L/kg) coupled with synergistic interactions with associated bacteria. Moreover, U. prolifera enriched key degrader taxa (Rhodobacteraceae, Methylophagaceae, Methylophylus, Alteromonas), enhancing atrazine degradation 2.5-fold via complementary metabolic pathways including dichlorination and dealkylation. These findings reveal a previously overlooked role of macroalgal ecosystems in sustaining coastal resilience and underscore their potential as scalable, nature-based solutions to mitigate herbicide pollution in global oceans. Ulva macroalgal ecosystem is a highly efficient natural bioremediation system, reducing coastal triazine herbicides by up to 89% through pathways involving macroalga-microbiome synergistic functions, according to a field investigation combined with designed simulation conducted in Yellow Sea, China.

title: Net carbon dioxide sequestration by large alkaline lakes dominates the carbon exchange of Qinghai-Tibet Plateau lakes
abstract:
Carbon flux data from 156 Qinghai-Tibet Plateau lakes reveal a net sink of around 7 Tg carbon per year during 2011–2022, about one-fifth of the regional terrestrial carbon sink, with projections indicating future changes under lake expansion and warming. 
 Alpine lakes on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau (QTP) are rapidly expanding under climate change, yet their role in the regional carbon budget remains unclear. Here we analyze carbon flux data from 156 alpine lakes of varying sizes and find that these lakes acted as a net carbon sink of 6.7 Tg C yr−1 during 2011–2022, approximately one-fifth of the terrestrial carbon sink over the QTP. This sink is dominated by alpine large alkaline lakes that sequester substantial carbon dioxide far outweighs carbon emissions from smaller lakes. Projected lake expansion under Shared Socioeconomic Pathway (SSP) scenarios indicates an increase in the lake carbon sink by 2100, with the magnitude of this increase varying inversely with scenario level due to the effect of rising water temperatures. When combined with reduced terrestrial carbon sequestration by inundated grasslands, the overall impact of lake expansion on regional carbon budgets depends on future warming rates. Our results highlight alpine lakes act as an important carbon sink and stress the need to account for carbon uptake by large alkaline lakes in regional carbon budget assessments. explanation: 这篇研究论文主要关注中国煤矿甲烷排放问题，通过结合省级产量数据和煤矿特定的排放因子，评估了2000年至2023年中国的煤矿甲烷排放量。研究发现不同地区的排放因子存在显著差异，并指出煤矿生产从高排放省份向低排放地区的转移导致了甲烷排放量的减少。该研究强调了区域生产转移和矿井特定特征在影响煤矿甲烷排放方面的重要作用。虽然甲烷是一种温室气体，与大气环境相关，但该研究的重点在于煤矿生产和排放因子的分析，而不是大气环境遥感技术，如空气质量监测或卫星观测。

title: Regional production shift and increased utilization dampen the growth of China’s coal mine methane emissions
abstract:
Varying geological conditions lead to difference in emission factors across regions, implying the important role of regional production shifts and mine specific characteristics on coal mine methane emissions in China, according to a study based on mine specific data and actual production 
 Methane emissions contribute to about 30% of global warming, with coal mining in China as a major source. Here we comprehensively assess coal mine methane emissions in China from 2000 to 2023 by combining provincial production data with coal mine-specific emission factors. We employ a methodological framework to identify key factors affecting emission factors of individual coal mines, estimate provincial production-weighted average emission factors, and assess their associated uncertainties using bootstrap simulations. The findings reveal distinct geographic patterns in emission factors, with higher values observed in the Southwest (e.g., Guizhou and Sichuan), while the North and Northwest regions (e.g., Inner Mongolia and Xinjiang) exhibit comparatively lower emission factors. Mine production shifts from high-emitting provinces to low-emitting regions resulted in total coal mine methane emission reduction after 2016. Our analysis highlights the critical role of regional production shifts and mine-specific characteristics in shaping coal mine methane emissions. Varying geological conditions lead to difference in emission factors across regions, implying the important role of regional production shifts and mine specific characteristics on coal mine methane emissions in China, according to a study based on mine specific data and actual production

title: What roles do dynamic and thermodynamic water vapor transport processes play in extreme precipitation over the Asian monsoon region?
abstract:
•Consistently stronger linear and nonlinear correlations exist for PWV-EP than IVT-EP across the AM region in ERA5 and CMIP6 GCMs. •Water vapor budget analysis shows that dynamic term is the most important driver to EP, while thermodynamic term is the least. •Thermodynamic water vapor transport process provides the robust basis for EP, and dynamic driver serves as a direct trigger. 
 The Asian monsoon (AM) region has experienced frequent extreme precipitation (EP) over the past decades. Effects of different drivers of water vapor transport process on EP remain unexplored. We thus investigate linear and nonlinear relationships between EP and concurrent precipitable water vapor (PWV) or vertically integrated water vapor transport (IVT), using ERA5 reanalysis and 15 CMIP6 global climate models (GCMs), and quantify relative contributions of dynamic and thermodynamic water vapor transport processes to EP. PWV is purely thermodynamic, whereas IVT combines thermodynamic and dynamic drivers. Results show that consistently stronger correlations exist for PWV-EP than IVT-EP over the AM region for both ERA5 and GCMs. However, water vapor budget analysis reveals transient dynamic term dominates EP. Two apparently opposite conclusions result from greater variability in horizontal wind than specific humidity, mathematically causing dynamic term being larger than thermodynamic term, and destabilizing IVT-EP correlations. In a word, the thermodynamic water vapor transport process provides the robust basis for EP, while the dynamic water vapor transport process serves as a direct trigger, jointly controlling EP.

title: Decadal changes and extreme events of aerosol over China: Spatiotemporal characteristics revealed by multi-satellite observations
abstract:
•Eastern China's AOD declined significantly (−0.11±0.05 decade⁻1, 2013–2022) due to sulfate reductions under air quality policies. •Extreme aerosol events decreased in eastern China (−0.005±0.03 day month⁻1decade⁻1) but surged in the Tarim Basin (+0.012±0.016 decade⁻1), revealing regional disparities in pollution control efficacy. •MERRA-2 overestimates AOD (4%) and clear-sky TOA trends (+0.50 W m⁻2decade⁻1) in eastern China, while aerosol-cloud interactions amplify uncertainties in all-sky radiation. 
 This study investigates the spatiotemporal characteristics and decadal changes of extreme aerosol events over China from 2013 to 2022, a critical period marked by China's Air Pollution Prevention and Control Action Plan and the Blue Sky Defense Campaign. While previous studies have documented general declines in aerosol levels, the behavior of extreme aerosol events and their associated climate impacts remain poorly quantified. By integrating multi-sensor remote sensing data, this study revealed that: (1) The eastern monsoon region exhibits a significant aerosol optical depth (AOD) decreasing trend (MERRA-2: −0.11 ± 0.05 decade−1), primarily driven by reduced sulfate aerosol (SU) concentrations (−0.005 ± 0.01 decade−1), whereas the Tarim Basin shows increasing AOD (0.012 ± 0.005 decade−1) due to enhanced dust (DU) activity; (2) Extreme aerosol events (EAEs) frequency displays a marginal decline in eastern China (−0.005 ± 0.03 day month−1 decade−1) but a marked increase in the Tarim Basin (0.012 ± 0.016 decade−1); (3) Intercomparison reveals MERRA-2 overestimates AOD by 4 % in central-southern China (0.7–1.2) and shows stronger clear-sky top of the Atmosphere (TOA) positive radiative trends (0.50 W m−2 decade−1) in eastern monsoon regions, indicating limitations in black carbon (BC) mixing-state parameterization; (4) Aerosol-cloud interactions amplify uncertainties in all-sky radiation trends, with CERES showing surface SW positive trends (0.36 ± 0.57 W m−2 decade−1) but TOA negative trends (−0.09 ± 0.36 W m−2 decade−1) over eastern China, establishing clear climate feedbacks associated with AOD reductions. Our observation-derived findings provide critical evidence for evaluating climate co-benefits of air quality policies and identifies key priorities for improving aerosol monitoring and model parameterizations, thereby constraining the uncertainty in assessing aerosol impacts in a changing environment.
